meanings.definition: A person who is not very intelligent or who does not have much experience
meanings.sent1: Some people may call others dummies if they make simple mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The teacher helped the dummies understand the math problem.
meanings.sent3: The dummies in the class always ask funny questions.
meanings.sent4: He felt like a dummy when he couldn't solve the puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The dummies in the group were always the last to understand.

meanings.definition: A model or replica of a human figure used for displaying clothes
meanings.sent1: The store used dummies to showcase their latest fashion collection.
meanings.sent2: The designer carefully dressed the dummy to attract customers.
meanings.sent3: The dummies in the window display looked so stylish.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a dummy while posing for the mannequin challenge.
meanings.sent5: The dummies in the store always wore the trendiest outfits.

meanings.definition: A book or set of instructions for beginners on a particular subject
meanings.sent1: The manual provided step-by-step guidance for the dummies in the class.
meanings.sent2: The dummies followed the instructions in the book to learn coding.
meanings.sent3: The dummies found the beginner's guide very helpful.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a dummy trying to follow the complex recipe.
meanings.sent5: The dummies quickly grasped the concepts explained in the book.
